trans-unit.source: Add Azure automation runbooks to recovery plans
trans-unit.target: Add Azure automation runbooks to recovery plans

trans-unit.source: This article describes how Azure Site Recovery now enables you to extend recovery plans using Azure Automation to complete complex tasks during recovery to Azure
trans-unit.target: This article describes how Azure Site Recovery now enables you to extend recovery plans using Azure Automation to complete complex tasks during recovery to Azure

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how Azure Site Recovery integrates with Azure Automation to provide extensibility to recovery plans.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how Azure Site Recovery integrates with Azure Automation to provide extensibility to recovery plans.

trans-unit.source: Recovery plans can orchestrate recovery of your virtual machines protected using Azure Site Recovery for both replication to secondary cloud and replication to Azure scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Recovery plans can orchestrate recovery of your virtual machines protected using Azure Site Recovery for both replication to secondary cloud and replication to Azure scenarios.

trans-unit.source: They also help in making the recovery consistently accurate, repeatable, and automated.
trans-unit.target: They also help in making the recovery consistently accurate, repeatable, and automated.

trans-unit.source: If you are failing over your virtual machines to Azure, integration with Azure Automation extends the recovery plans and gives you capability to execute runbooks, thus allowing powerful automation tasks.
trans-unit.target: If you are failing over your virtual machines to Azure, integration with Azure Automation extends the recovery plans and gives you capability to execute runbooks, thus allowing powerful automation tasks.

trans-unit.source: If you have not heard about Azure Automation yet, sign up <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> and download their sample scripts <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not heard about Azure Automation yet, sign up <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> and download their sample scripts <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Read more about <linkText>Azure Site Recovery</linkText><title></title> and how to orchestrate recovery to Azure using recovery plans <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about <linkText>Azure Site Recovery</linkText><title></title> and how to orchestrate recovery to Azure using recovery plans <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will look at how you can integrate Azure Automation runbooks into recovery plans.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will look at how you can integrate Azure Automation runbooks into recovery plans.

trans-unit.source: We will automate simple tasks that earlier required manual intervention and see how to convert a multi-step recovery into a single-click recovery action.
trans-unit.target: We will automate simple tasks that earlier required manual intervention and see how to convert a multi-step recovery into a single-click recovery action.

trans-unit.source: We will also look at how you can troubleshoot a simple script if it goes wrong.
trans-unit.target: We will also look at how you can troubleshoot a simple script if it goes wrong.

trans-unit.source: Let us begin with a simple application consisting of two virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Let us begin with a simple application consisting of two virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Here, we have a HRweb application of Fabrikam.
trans-unit.target: Here, we have a HRweb application of Fabrikam.

trans-unit.source: Fabrikam-HRweb-frontend and Fabrikam-Hrweb-backend are the two virtual machines protected to Azure using Azure Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: Fabrikam-HRweb-frontend and Fabrikam-Hrweb-backend are the two virtual machines protected to Azure using Azure Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: To protect the virtual machines using Azure Site Recovery, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To protect the virtual machines using Azure Site Recovery, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Enable protection for your virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Enable protection for your virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the virtual machines have completed initial replication and are replicating.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the virtual machines have completed initial replication and are replicating.

trans-unit.source: Wait till the initial replication completes and the Replication status says Protected.
trans-unit.target: Wait till the initial replication completes and the Replication status says Protected.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will create a recovery plan for the Fabrikam HRweb application to failover the application to Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will create a recovery plan for the Fabrikam HRweb application to failover the application to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Then we will integrate it with a runbook that will create an endpoint on the failed over Azure virtual machine to serve web pages at port 80.
trans-unit.target: Then we will integrate it with a runbook that will create an endpoint on the failed over Azure virtual machine to serve web pages at port 80.

trans-unit.source: First, let's create a recovery plan for our application.
trans-unit.target: First, let's create a recovery plan for our application.

trans-unit.source: To recover the application to Azure, you need to create a recovery plan.
trans-unit.target: To recover the application to Azure, you need to create a recovery plan.

trans-unit.source: Using a recovery plan you can specify the order of recovery of the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Using a recovery plan you can specify the order of recovery of the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine placed in group 1 will recover and start first, and then the virtual machine in group 2 will follow.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine placed in group 1 will recover and start first, and then the virtual machine in group 2 will follow.

trans-unit.source: Create a Recovery Plan that looks like below.
trans-unit.target: Create a Recovery Plan that looks like below.

trans-unit.source: To read more about recovery plans, read documentation <linkText>here</linkText><title>here</title>.
trans-unit.target: To read more about recovery plans, read documentation <linkText>here</linkText><title>here</title>.

trans-unit.source: Next, let's create the necessary artifacts in Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: Next, let's create the necessary artifacts in Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: You need an Azure Automation account to create runbooks.
trans-unit.target: You need an Azure Automation account to create runbooks.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have an account, navigate to Azure Automation tab denoted by <linkText></linkText>and create a new account.
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have an account, navigate to Azure Automation tab denoted by <linkText></linkText>and create a new account.

trans-unit.source: Give the account a name to identify with.
trans-unit.target: Give the account a name to identify with.

trans-unit.source: Specify a geographical region where you want to place the account.
trans-unit.target: Specify a geographical region where you want to place the account.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to place the account in the same region as the ASR vault.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to place the account in the same region as the ASR vault.

trans-unit.source: Next, create the following assets in the Account.
trans-unit.target: Next, create the following assets in the Account.

trans-unit.source: Add a new setting <linkText></linkText> in the Azure Automation Assets and select to <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Add a new setting <linkText></linkText> in the Azure Automation Assets and select to <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the variable type as String
trans-unit.target: Select the variable type as String

trans-unit.source: Specify variable name as AzureSubscriptionName
trans-unit.target: Specify variable name as AzureSubscriptionName

trans-unit.source: Specify your actual Azure Subscription name as the variable value.
trans-unit.target: Specify your actual Azure Subscription name as the variable value.

trans-unit.source: You can identify the name of your subscription from the settings page of your account on the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can identify the name of your subscription from the settings page of your account on the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Azure Automation uses Azure PowerShell to connect to the subscription and operates on the artifacts there.
trans-unit.target: Azure Automation uses Azure PowerShell to connect to the subscription and operates on the artifacts there.

trans-unit.source: For this, you need to authenticate using your Microsoft account or a work or school account.
trans-unit.target: For this, you need to authenticate using your Microsoft account or a work or school account.

trans-unit.source: You can store the account credentials in an asset to be used securely by the runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can store the account credentials in an asset to be used securely by the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Add a new setting <linkText></linkText> in the Azure Automation Assets and select <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Add a new setting <linkText></linkText> in the Azure Automation Assets and select <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the Credential type as Windows PowerShell Credential
trans-unit.target: Select the Credential type as Windows PowerShell Credential

trans-unit.source: Specify the name as AzureCredential
trans-unit.target: Specify the name as AzureCredential

trans-unit.source: Specify the username and password to sign-in with.
trans-unit.target: Specify the username and password to sign-in with.

trans-unit.source: Now both these settings are available in your assets.
trans-unit.target: Now both these settings are available in your assets.

trans-unit.source: More information about how to connect to your subscription via powershell is given <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: More information about how to connect to your subscription via powershell is given <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will create a runbook in Azure Automation that can add an endpoint for the front-end virtual machine after failover.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will create a runbook in Azure Automation that can add an endpoint for the front-end virtual machine after failover.

trans-unit.source: ASR passes a context variable to the runbook to help you write deterministic scripts.
trans-unit.target: ASR passes a context variable to the runbook to help you write deterministic scripts.

trans-unit.source: One could argue that the names of the Cloud Service and the Virtual Machine are predictable, but happens that it is not always the case owing to certain scenarios such as the one where the name of the virtual machine name might have changed due to unsupported characters in Azure.
trans-unit.target: One could argue that the names of the Cloud Service and the Virtual Machine are predictable, but happens that it is not always the case owing to certain scenarios such as the one where the name of the virtual machine name might have changed due to unsupported characters in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Hence this information is passed to the ASR recovery plan as part of the context.
trans-unit.target: Hence this information is passed to the ASR recovery plan as part of the context.

trans-unit.source: Below is an example of how the context variable looks.
trans-unit.target: Below is an example of how the context variable looks.

trans-unit.source: The table below contains name and description for each variable in the context.
trans-unit.target: The table below contains name and description for each variable in the context.

trans-unit.source: Variable name
trans-unit.target: Variable name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: RecoveryPlanName
trans-unit.target: RecoveryPlanName

trans-unit.source: Name of plan being run.
trans-unit.target: Name of plan being run.

trans-unit.source: Helps you take action based on name using the same script
trans-unit.target: Helps you take action based on name using the same script

trans-unit.source: FailoverType
trans-unit.target: FailoverType

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the failover is test, planned, or unplanned.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the failover is test, planned, or unplanned.

trans-unit.source: FailoverDirection
trans-unit.target: FailoverDirection

trans-unit.source: Specify whether recovery is to primary or secondary
trans-unit.target: Specify whether recovery is to primary or secondary

trans-unit.source: GroupID
trans-unit.target: GroupID

trans-unit.source: Identify the group number within the recovery plan when the plan is running
trans-unit.target: Identify the group number within the recovery plan when the plan is running

trans-unit.source: VmMap
trans-unit.target: VmMap

trans-unit.source: Array of all the virtual machines in the group
trans-unit.target: Array of all the virtual machines in the group

trans-unit.source: VMMap key
trans-unit.target: VMMap key

trans-unit.source: Unique key (GUID) for each VM.
trans-unit.target: Unique key (GUID) for each VM.

trans-unit.source: It's the same as the VMM ID of the virtual machine where applicable.
trans-unit.target: It's the same as the VMM ID of the virtual machine where applicable.

trans-unit.source: RoleName
trans-unit.target: RoleName

trans-unit.source: Name of the Azure VM that's being recovered
trans-unit.target: Name of the Azure VM that's being recovered

trans-unit.source: CloudServiceName
trans-unit.target: CloudServiceName

trans-unit.source: Azure Cloud Service name under which the virtual machine is created.
trans-unit.target: Azure Cloud Service name under which the virtual machine is created.

trans-unit.source: To identify the VmMap Key in the context you could also go to the VM properties page in ASR and look at the VM GUID property.
trans-unit.target: To identify the VmMap Key in the context you could also go to the VM properties page in ASR and look at the VM GUID property.

trans-unit.source: Now create the runbook to open port 80 on the front-end virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Now create the runbook to open port 80 on the front-end virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a new runbook in the Azure Automation account with the name OpenPort80
trans-unit.target: Create a new runbook in the Azure Automation account with the name OpenPort80

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Author view of the runbook and enter the draft mode.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Author view of the runbook and enter the draft mode.

trans-unit.source: First specify the variable to use as the recovery plan context
trans-unit.target: First specify the variable to use as the recovery plan context

trans-unit.source: Next connect to the subscription using the credential and subscription name
trans-unit.target: Next connect to the subscription using the credential and subscription name

trans-unit.source: Note that you use the Azure assets – AzureCredential and AzureSubscriptionName here.
trans-unit.target: Note that you use the Azure assets – AzureCredential and AzureSubscriptionName here.

trans-unit.source: Now specify the endpoint details and the GUID of the virtual machine for which you want to expose the endpoint, in this case the front-end virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Now specify the endpoint details and the GUID of the virtual machine for which you want to expose the endpoint, in this case the front-end virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This specifies the Azure endpoint protocol, local port on the VM and its mapped public port.
trans-unit.target: This specifies the Azure endpoint protocol, local port on the VM and its mapped public port.

trans-unit.source: These variables are parameters required by the Azure commands that add endpoints to VMs.
trans-unit.target: These variables are parameters required by the Azure commands that add endpoints to VMs.

trans-unit.source: The VMGUID holds the GUID of the virtual machine you need to operate on.
trans-unit.target: The VMGUID holds the GUID of the virtual machine you need to operate on.

trans-unit.source: The script will now extract the context for the given VM GUID and create an endpoint on the virtual machine referenced by it.
trans-unit.target: The script will now extract the context for the given VM GUID and create an endpoint on the virtual machine referenced by it.

trans-unit.source: Once this is complete, hit Publish <linkText></linkText> to allow your script to be available for execution.
trans-unit.target: Once this is complete, hit Publish <linkText></linkText> to allow your script to be available for execution.

trans-unit.source: The complete script is given below for your reference
trans-unit.target: The complete script is given below for your reference

trans-unit.source: Once the script is ready, you can add it to the recovery plan that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Once the script is ready, you can add it to the recovery plan that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: In the recovery plan you created, choose to add a script after the group 2.
trans-unit.target: In the recovery plan you created, choose to add a script after the group 2.

trans-unit.source: Specify a script name.
trans-unit.target: Specify a script name.

trans-unit.source: This is just a friendly name for this script for showing within the Recovery plan.
trans-unit.target: This is just a friendly name for this script for showing within the Recovery plan.

trans-unit.source: In the failover to Azure script – Select the Azure Automation Account name.
trans-unit.target: In the failover to Azure script – Select the Azure Automation Account name.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Runbooks, select the runbook you authored.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Runbooks, select the runbook you authored.

trans-unit.source: When you are executing a failover to Azure, you can also choose to execute primary side scripts.
trans-unit.target: When you are executing a failover to Azure, you can also choose to execute primary side scripts.

trans-unit.source: These scripts will run on the VMM server during failover.
trans-unit.target: These scripts will run on the VMM server during failover.

trans-unit.source: Primary side scripts are only available only for pre-shutdown and post shutdown stages.
trans-unit.target: Primary side scripts are only available only for pre-shutdown and post shutdown stages.

trans-unit.source: This is because we expect the primary site to be typically unavailable when a disaster strikes.
trans-unit.target: This is because we expect the primary site to be typically unavailable when a disaster strikes.

trans-unit.source: During an unplanned failover, only if you opt in for primary site operations, it will attempt to run the primary side scripts.
trans-unit.target: During an unplanned failover, only if you opt in for primary site operations, it will attempt to run the primary side scripts.

trans-unit.source: If they are not reachable or timeout, the failover will continue to recover the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If they are not reachable or timeout, the failover will continue to recover the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Primary side scripts are un-available for VMware/Physical/Hyper-v Sites without VMM protected to Azure - while you failover to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Primary side scripts are un-available for VMware/Physical/Hyper-v Sites without VMM protected to Azure - while you failover to Azure.

trans-unit.source: However, when you failback from Azure to on-premises, priamry side scripts (Runbooks) can be used for all targets except VMware.
trans-unit.target: However, when you failback from Azure to on-premises, priamry side scripts (Runbooks) can be used for all targets except VMware.

trans-unit.source: Once you have added the runbook to the plan you can initiate a test failover and see it in action.
trans-unit.target: Once you have added the runbook to the plan you can initiate a test failover and see it in action.

trans-unit.source: It is always recommended to run a test failover to test your application and the recovery plan to ensure that there are no errors.
trans-unit.target: It is always recommended to run a test failover to test your application and the recovery plan to ensure that there are no errors.

trans-unit.source: Select the recovery plan and initiate a test failover.
trans-unit.target: Select the recovery plan and initiate a test failover.

trans-unit.source: During the plan execution, you can see whether the runbook has executed or not via its status.
trans-unit.target: During the plan execution, you can see whether the runbook has executed or not via its status.

trans-unit.source: You can also see the detailed runbook execution status on the Azure Automation jobs page for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can also see the detailed runbook execution status on the Azure Automation jobs page for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: After the failover completes, apart from the runbook execution result, you can see whether the execution is successful or not by visiting the Azure virtual machine page and looking at the endpoints.
trans-unit.target: After the failover completes, apart from the runbook execution result, you can see whether the execution is successful or not by visiting the Azure virtual machine page and looking at the endpoints.

trans-unit.source: While we walked through automating one commonly used task of adding an endpoint to an Azure virtual machine in this tutorial, you could do a number of other powerful automation tasks using Azure automation.
trans-unit.target: While we walked through automating one commonly used task of adding an endpoint to an Azure virtual machine in this tutorial, you could do a number of other powerful automation tasks using Azure automation.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft and the Azure Automation community provide sample runbooks which can help you get started creating your own solutions, and utility runbooks, which you can use as building blocks for larger automation tasks.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft and the Azure Automation community provide sample runbooks which can help you get started creating your own solutions, and utility runbooks, which you can use as building blocks for larger automation tasks.

trans-unit.source: Start using them from the gallery and build powerful one-click recovery plans for your applications using Azure Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: Start using them from the gallery and build powerful one-click recovery plans for your applications using Azure Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Automation Overview</linkText><title>Azure Automation Overview</title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Automation Overview</linkText><title>Azure Automation Overview</title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sample Azure Automation Scripts</linkText><title>Sample Azure Automation Scripts</title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sample Azure Automation Scripts</linkText><title>Sample Azure Automation Scripts</title>
